page.title: 12Kirkpatrick's Garage Brigham
page.content: Kirkpatrick's garage is in{Low Brigham on the old A66 road. The garage was started in{1926}by{Mr Kirkpatrick's {father.}In{1945 Mr Kirkpatrick}took over. At the garage Mr Kirkpatrick employs ten drivers not including himself and his son Bill. The youngest person that works there is 22 and the oldest man, Harry Dent has worked there 30 years. The coaches are bought from{Kirkby's, {Sheffield. British Leyland}make the chasis and the engines but they have Duple bodies. Some of the drivers are mechanics at the garage. As well as bus driving at the garage they do servicing and{M.O.T tests.}The other vehicles are taxis ,two limousines and a hearse for funerals. The buses take workmen to work, school children to school and pensioners on trips and clubs on outings.
